channel.title: Harddrive and USB
channel.description: heyy i was juss wondering is it possible for me to hook up a IDE or SATA harddrive to my desktop using a USB.? like is there a cord or wire which has a USB head on one side n a Hardrive serial/parrellel port on the other side? that way i dont have to always open up my case and put in and take out the harddrive.. you may ask why i need this, well i need 2 harddrives for two of my classes at school.. and at school we use a removable tray for both harddrives. so was juss wondering if there is such thing as a wire like that.. i need it only for my IDE hardrive.. thanks darkilla :)

item.title: Harddrive and USB
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

lol well thanks for now… now i juss gota find a place i can buy it from where i live

that way i dont have to always open up my case and put in and take out the harddrive… you may ask why i need this, well i need 2 harddrives for two of my classes at school… and at school we use a removable tray for both harddrives.
so was juss wondering if there is such thing as a wire like that… i need it only for my IDE hardrive…
thanks darkilla :)[/quote]

item.title: Harddrive and USB
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I had some gadget that worked through 2 USB ports, it would work with any laptop/ide/sata drive and transfer data pretty damn fast… I transffered 50gb of data in just a few minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Harddrive and USB
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:3, topic:283921”][quote author=Niall link=topic=375234.msg2828211#msg2828211 date=1245192754]
You could get a harddrive enclosure.
[/quote]
It’s an easy conversion, but be warned USB is much slower than an IDE/SATA bus.[/quote]
Plus the conversion is cheap. Its only about 3 times slower…
But carrying around a normal hard disk can be very dangerous so you have to be extra careful with it. I manage to break ordinary hard drives when they are still inside a computer case!

Read full topic
